sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be subtracted from each of the numbers \(6 \), \(13 \), and \(21 \) to make the reminders be in continued proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{Lets suppose that the required number is $x $.

Since the numbers $6 - x $, $\input[s1v1]{} - x $, $21 - x $, are in proportion, we have}$$
\[
	\frac{6 - x }{13 - x } = \frac{13 - x }{21 - x }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (\input[s2v1]{} - x )(21 - x ) = (13 - x )(13 - x )
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{} - x (27 ) + x ^2 = 169 - x (26 ) + x ^2
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow x(\input[s4v1]{} - 27 ) = 169 - 126 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} - 126 }{26 - 27 }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{\input[s6v1{} }{-1 }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{\inpu[s7v1]{} }{1 }
\]"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [13], "text": "$$\text{Suppose the required number that needs to be subtracted from each given number is x. Then, the new set of numbers would be $6 - x $, $13 - x $, $21 - x $,. Since these numbers are in continued proportion, we can write:$\frac{6 - x }{13 - x } = \frac{13 - x }{21 - x }$}$$ "}, {"data": [6], "text": " Cross-multiplying the above equation, we get: $ (6 - x )(21 - x ) = (13 - x )(13 - x ) $"}, {"data": [126], "text": "Expanding the above equation, we get: $ 126 - x (27 ) + x ^2 = 169 - x (26 ) + x ^2$ "}, {"data": [26], "text": " Bringing all the common terms on one side, we get: $x (26 - 27 ) = 169 - 126$"}, {"data": [169], "text": "Further simplification will get us this equation $x = \frac{169 - 126 }{26 - 27 }$ "}, {"data": [43], "text": "Upon further arithmetic calculation, we achieve this: $x = \frac{43 }{-1 }$ "}, {"data": [-43], "text": "Out final result would be $x = \frac{-43 }{1 }$ "}]
